snippet: Taxpayers should love Citigroup even if shareholders don’t. And, on the bank’s 200th birthday, here’s why.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column charges that taxpayers should love Citigroup even if its shareholders do not; maintains that Citibank CEO Vikram Pandit--unlike Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase--has been deeply humbled by the 2008 financial crisis and has been carefully shedding bad assets and building up the bank's capital to assure that taxpayers are putting their money in a safe institution.
lead_paragraph: Taxpayers should love Citigroup even if shareholders don’t. And, on the bank’s 200th birthday, here’s why.
